repnme.cdata!: Guinea Bissau - Basic Education Development Project

abstracts.cdata!:
This is the Implementation Completion
            Report (ICR) for the Basic Education Development Project
            (PDEB) in Guinea-Bissau. PDEB had two major objectives: the
            first was to improve the quality, efficiency, and access of
            basic education through: (i) teacher training; (ii)
            inspector training; (iii) improvement of the curriculum and
            teaching materials; and (iv) rehabilitation and construction
            of primary schools. The second was to strengthen education
            management and planning through: (i) reform of the Ministry
            of Education's (MECD, later MEN) organizational
            structure, and (ii) establishment of a project coordination
            unit (PCU). Overall Bank performance was unsatisfactory.
            Overall, borrower performance was unsatisfactory. The key
            lessons learned were: (a) International Development
            Association (IDA) overestimated the capacity of the
            implementing agencies and expected results far too quickly;
            (b) complex project management arrangements that are put in
            place and that require a high degree of internal
            coordination within a ministry, which itself is undergoing
            institutional restructuring, do not work well; (c) pilot
            experiments can help reduce the risk of failure in the
            undertaking of an ambitious educational reform program and
            can help in designing appropriate solutions to achieve the
            objectives of the program; (d) pre-appraisal and appraisal
            missions need to identify and assess more carefully the
            Borrower's implementation capacity and help design a
            realistic project that can be implemented; and (e ) borrower
            commitment is essential to successful project
            implementation. Borrower commitment in evidence during
            identification and preparation must continue throughout implementation.

abstracts.cdata!:
The Basic Education Project will provide
            the institutional and policy framework for integrating
            investment in the education sector. To support the
            Government's major policy objectives for educational
            development, the project will upgrade the quality and
            increase access to education. This will be accomplished in
            two ways. Firstly, the project will improve the content and
            relevance of the primary education curriculum and teaching
            materials and improve pre-service and in-service primary
            teacher training programs. To the same end, the project will
            strengthen the teacher inspectorate services, train 3,000
            primary teachers, and rehabilitate dilapidated primary
            schools. Secondly, the project will develop the
            institutional capacity of the Ministry of Education, Culture
            and Sports (MECD) by establishing an efficient
            organizational structure for MECD and providing basic office
            equipment, materials and improved physical facilities.
            Finally, the project will introduce budgetary and efficiency
            measures to reduce costs and link expenditures to
            educational development priorities.
